meanings.sent1: The corrosivenesses of the acid were evident in its ability to eat through metal.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the corrosivenesses of different chemicals to determine their effects on various materials.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten learned about the corrosivenesses of its sharp claws when it accidentally scratched the furniture.
meanings.sent4: The corrosivenesses of time slowly wore away at the ancient statue, leaving it weathered and worn.
meanings.sent5: The corrosivenesses of the harsh environment made it difficult for the metal structures to withstand the elements.

meanings.sent1: The factory workers were trained to handle chemicals with high corrosivenesses to prevent accidents.
meanings.sent2: The metal showed signs of corrosion due to the corrosivenesses present in the air.
meanings.sent3: The classroom erupted into laughter when the teacher jokingly referred to the students' messy desks as 'corrosivenesses'.
meanings.sent4: The corrosivenesses of the situation ate away at their friendship, leaving only bitterness behind.
meanings.sent5: The corrosivenesses of the harsh cleaning chemicals made her eyes water as she scrubbed the bathroom tiles.

meanings.sent1: The high humidity in the coastal region increased the corrosivenesses of the salt in the air.
meanings.sent2: The engineer considered the corrosivenesses of the environment when designing the new bridge.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child blamed the corrosivenesses of the rain for causing the paint on the fence to peel off.
meanings.sent4: The corrosivenesses of neglect slowly ate away at the once pristine facade of the historic building.
meanings.sent5: The corrosivenesses of gossip can erode trust and damage relationships over time.
